news.title: Trump aims to fight China's control of minerals by investing in miners
news.summary: Interior Secretary Doug Burgum: China dumps critical minerals, collapsing prices. Burgum says it's making it difficult for U.S. companies to compete.

news.title: Orders for big-ticket items like autos and appliances surged 9.2% in March in rush to beat tariffs
news.summary: Transportation equipment orders surged 27%, led by a 139% increase in nondefense aircraft and parts. Transportation equipment orders were up 27% from last year.

news.title: Procter & Gamble CEO says price hikes are 'likely,' as Tide owner cuts outlook due to tariffs, uncertainty
news.summary: Procter & Gamble's quarterly earnings topped estimates, but its revenue fell short of expectations. Procter&Grips' quarterly revenue also missed expectations.

news.title: American Airlines withdraws 2025 forecast on murky economic outlook
news.summary: American Airlines joins Delta, Southwest and Alaska in pulling its 2025 financial guidance. American Airlines joined Delta, South Carolina, Alaska and other airlines in pulling their 2025 guidance.

news.title: Bristol Myers Squibb tops quarterly estimates, hikes outlook as drugmaker braces for tariffs
news.summary: The guidance revisions include the estimated impact of current tariffs on U.S. products shipped to China. But not Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.

news.title: Merck absorbs $200 million in tariff costs into its earnings and full-year outlook
news.summary: Shares of Merck & Co. were headed higher in early Thursday trading. The drugmaker extended its long streak of quarterly earnings beats and held firm with its full-year outlook.

news.title: ‘Elon’s not going anywhere’: Trump White House says Musk has more work to do at ‘DOGE’
news.summary: Elon Musk says he will spend more time at Tesla, but the White House expects him to continue “dedicating a lot of his time”’ to supporting the president.

news.title: Boeing contracts and tariff ‘front-running’ boost durable-goods orders.  It won’t last if trade wars keep raging.
news.summary: Boeing contracts and companies seeking to stock up ahead of the Trump tariffs sent orders for U.S. durable goods soaring in March. The strength is unlikely to last as trade wars begin to bite.

news.title: Jobless claims remain in stable range, as labor market is seen frozen in place
news.summary: At the start of the year, the labor market was strong. Now there is a lack of churn, one economist says. "It's a sign of things to come," he says.

news.title: This strategist warned of a selloff in December. He’s watching these two signals to confirm if stocks have bottomed.
news.summary: Investors have gotten one signal the stock market bottom is in, they just need this one to confirm, says Warren Pies, founder and strategist at 3Fourteen Research.
